title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL

items.title: What’s More Dangerous than India’s Frequent Heat Waves? Heat Stress.
items.description: Women who face long-term heat exposure in workplaces and homes are finding it takes a heavy toll on their health and income.

items.title: 4 Dead After Suspected Migrant Boat Overturns Near a San Diego Area Beach
items.description: The boat capsized off the coast, officials said. Four people were taken to a hospital and one person was taken into custody.

items.title: U.S. Border Patrol Launches Operation in Charlotte, N.C.
items.description: It is unclear how long the operation will last in North Carolina’s largest city, which has a growing immigrant population.

items.title: A red meat allergy caused by ticks killed a N.J. man. Here's what to know
items.description: Researchers say they believe they've documented the first known death from alpha-gal syndrome — a red meat allergy caused by tick bites.

items.title: Americana troubadour Todd Snider, alt-country singer-songwriter, dies at 59
items.description: Known for his cosmic-stoner songwriting and freewheeling tunes, Todd Snider's career spanned three decades.

items.title: Vatican to Return Indigenous Cultural Items to Canada Taken a Century Ago
items.description: Dozen of pieces used in a 1925 exhibition, including a whale-hunting kayak, will be returned to Canada early next month.

items.title: A Challenge to Canada’s Official Policy That the U.S. Is Safe for Migrants
items.description: A former Liberal immigration minister said that Canada should drop an agreement that allows it to return asylum seekers who enter from the U.S.
